results.title: The Hidden side of selling
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold, Roundtable Productions and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: Shows how sales personnel can increase their sales by learning how to deal with those customers whose reactions are hardest for them to handle. Creates an awareness of the psychological problems and hidden influences frequently encountered but often overlooked in selling situations.

results.title: The Hidden side of cards: the cheat with the ace of diamonds (about 1635) by Georges De La Tour (Vic sur Seille 1593 - Luneville 1652)
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Delta Image, La Sept, FR3 and Musée du Louvre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
La Tour is a recently rediscovered painter, whose few works were previously attributed to a variety of painters, from Murillo to Velasquez. This painting fits into the genre of paintings of the early sixteenth century which depicted fortune tellers, gamblers and prostitutes. This program compares the painting to another version of the same painting, explores the symbolism of the painting, La Tour’s technique and the historical context.

results.title: The Hidden potential
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
Marion Fine used no drugs to relieve pain after major surgery, relying instead on techniques of self-hypnosis to both relieve the pain and promote rapid healing. Marion’s case vividly demonstrates the importance of patient attitude in the healing process, a factor increasingly recognised by practitioners of traditional medicine. This program demonstrates the history and techniques of hypnosis to relieve pain, bio-feedback and the Pain Education Program for non-drug pain relief, conducted at Macquarie University in Sydney.

results.title: The Hidden land
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and N.S. Thapa
results.brief_description: All along India’s northern frontier run the Himalayas, a formidable chain of snow-clad mountains and glacial valleys. Clothed in this cold and glittering mantle lies the kingdom of Bhutan, remote and mystic. This film is a study of this neighbouring kingdom, its people and their art and culture. Narrated by Berkeley Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and N.S. Thapa

results.title: The Hidden grievance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.
Part of a six film series dramatising case problems met within industry. This film helps to make supervisors aware of the need for sensitivity in recognising and understanding underlying causes of an employee grievance in order to handle it satisfactorily.

results.title: The Hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird, Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Alcohol in road accidents. The effect of alcohol and self-control; medical opinion estimates that the official figures on road accidents greatly underestimate the role of alcohol; the need for a scientific standard of intoxication; how the blood test helps police and protects passengers and others on the road; how the carelessness induced by alcohol frequently ends in tragedy. The story follows several people who combine drinking with driving.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: expectations
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Film Australia and Janet Isaac
results.brief_description: Looks at sex stereotyping in schools. A female teacher and her children discuss the reaction of the children to the teacher’s engagement, and to boys carrying out some activities often thought of as female-oriented, e.g. cooking, sewing. Also includes a discussion between a female principal and other teachers about women at the top and pupils choosing a course/sport regardless of gender. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: attitudes
results.brief_description: One of a group of films about sex role stereotyping in schools. Examines the response of students and teachers to a female principal, and her own attitudes to her position. No other credits available.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: assumptions
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Film Australia and Janet Isaac
results.brief_description: This short film revfeals some of the effects of sex role stereotyping and is intended to trigger group discussion. Children of different age groups ranging from kindergarten to senior secondary students refveal their attitudes to girls, mothers and the female role. Parents have higher career expectations of their sons than of their daughters. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
